page.title: 14HOUSING CHANGES (1814-1985)
page.content: It is interesting to compare the settlement pattern in the area with that shown on the original drawings (made at a scale of two inches to one mile) by the Ordnance Survey in 1814. This was the source from which the first edition of the One Inch to One Mile map was prepared and published in 1831. Another important source map is the Tithe Survey map of the parish which dates from 1840.Copies of all these maps are held in the National Library of Wales in Aberystwyth. Of the 33 places depicted on the maps of this area, 25 still exist and have the same or a similar name;and only 8 have disappeared. In more than a century only two new farms have been built and we know that this followed enclosure of the Great Forest of Brecknock after the Napoleonic Wars.
